Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape: Whodunit?
Description:
In this eerie, yet family-friendly, murder mystery, you have been invited to Burke Manor for the reading of your great-uncle’s will.  You have never heard of him before and getting the call was quite the shock.  It turns out that 7 others were also called to stay the night at the fancy mansion.  The grounds are gorgeous and hide swimming pools, hiking trails, a hedge maze, and even riding stables, but they are nothing compared to the mansion itself.  30 rooms are connected by a series of hallways, dumbwaiters, staircases, and secret passages.  Shortly after you all gather together, however, you discover this isn’t going to be a weekend getaway.  One of your number wants the inheritance all to themself.  One by one, the other guests are murdered… and it is up to you to solve each and every crime.  Compete against your other detectives as you watch the number of suspects shrink.  If you find a clue… do you share it with the others?  Or do you keep it for yourself?  Just be careful… as you may just be the next victim yourself!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Gnomistic
Description:
Gnomistic is a competitive game of tactics, strategy, hand management, set collection and other various mechanisms for 1 to 6 players.

SHORT OVERVIEW:
Imagine that you and your friends are on an excursion in a forest in Ireland, when suddenly, someone yells “I have seen a gnome!”. Now, a magical wave of greed controls your mind and the only thing that matters is getting the gnome's pot of gold at any cost, so you must guide yourself from the correct signs on the way to get it.

Play different signal cards on the correct path when the time is right and if it pairs with another matching card, you get them all. This will cause you to have a lot of cards in your play area (a lot, and it feels strange and satisfying!), but you will need even more to be able to complete the positive sets and avoid the negative ones, and then save those cards in the only safe place where no one can take them away: your chest. But be careful, you should also be aware of the right time to save them, because bad things can happen if you save too soon, if you miss the perfect opportunity or if you accidentally complete negative sets, if you run out of coins or if someone uses magic cards against you ... And if the latter happens, don't worry ... maybe you can get revenge sooner than you think and with twice the strength.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pharmageddon: Bugs vs Drugs
Description:
Pharmageddon is a medical education card game. A fun way to learn antibiotics and microbiology. Play the best antibiotic to kill the most pathogens with the fewest side effects. There are two decks of cards: Bug Cards (bacteria and syndromes) and Drug Cards (antibiotics). Each player uses Drug Cards to slay Bug Cards which slowly fill up a 3 x 3 playing area. If you successfully match an effective Drug to a susceptible Bug you get to keep matching and killing more. If you fail, play moves on to the next player, and the Bug Card may become more resistant. Each drug has its own side effects and flora costs, though, so choose your Drug Cards wisely. Guess wrong too many times and the 3 x 3 playing area will be overwhelmed. If that happens you lose a life. Game ends when either the players survive the Bug Card onslaught and complete the Bug Card deck or all players lose all their lives.

Solo and versus modes, varying levels of difficulty, and expert scoring options are also available.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rolling Heights: Kickstarter Promo Pack – Designer and Angry Ape Micro Expansion
Description:
Big Cities have a way of attracting Big Problems!

The newly built city of Rolling Heights is being attacked by a giant creature! Will the defenders of Rolling Heights capture the beast before it destroys the city?

Find out with the 3-5minute bonus mini-game included with all Kickstarter pledges! One player takes the role of the beast trying to destroy the city by knocking over the building. The other players are the defenders of the city and try to capture the beast before all is lost.

In addition, John D Clair Bonus Building Tiles are in the expansion.
Each of these 5 bonus buildings are themed after one of AEG's other games that John D Clair designed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rolling Heights: Kickstarter Promo Pack – Waterfront Properties and World's Fair Expansion
Description:
Rolling Heights: Bonus Building Tiles includes the following

(5) Waterfront Properties
Location Location Location! The most valuable land in a city tends to near the waterfront, and this series of buildings is designed to take full advantage of those locations

(5) World's Fair Building Tiles

Name: The Pacific War: Deadly Bloody Battles of Combined Fleet
Description:
Strategic level wargame based on World War 2 Pacific theater. The basic game engine is inspired from Taiheiki.

Units represent admirals of Imperial Japan or Allied Nations, and their naval and air strength.

In each turn, players roll die for initiative, and then move admirals alternately by initiative .
Battles, control of sea zone and replacement are affected by admiral's abilities.

Victory points that determine the winner of the game are mainly obtained by controlling 14 sea areas, and also from the killed in action of enemy admirals.

Name: The London Pub Crawl
Description:
The London Pub Crawl is easy to pick-up-and-play so that new and old friends can join in quickly. The game board has includes a simplified set of the rules for those more forgetful pub crawlers...


     Start the Crawl - Roll the die to discover where you start on the game board and pull your first Pub Card.
     How to Crawl - Start each turn by pulling a Crawl Card, read it aloud and play the action on the back.
     Where to Crawl - Then roll the die and take any path you wish to reach the location on your Pub Card.
     Crawl to Victory - when you reach your first Pub, draw your next Pub Card and continue playing until you become the first player to reach three pubs and declare *burp* victory!


—description from the publisher

Name: Wicked Apples: Hexed
Description: The Wicked Apples: Hexed expansion adds 4 new apples (Charmed, Wickedest, Squished, and Sour) to expand the deck to 32 apples.

Name: Shaking Sunflower
Description: The game consist of a shaking sunflower that is dancing during the game to make the players' task more difficult. Each player has their own set of marbles which they shall place on the sunflower's flowers. The first player to place all their marbles is the winner.

Name: Wicked Apples: Grim
Description: The Wicked Apples: Grim expansion adds 4 new apples (Telekinetic Apple, Apthulu Apple, Shadow Apple, and Cursed Apple) which can be swapped with apples from the original deck to change up the game.

Name: Unlikely Heroes: Archaic Beginnings Expansion
Description:
The Archaic Beginnings Expansion is a fun addition to the three core boxes: Vikings, Pharaohs, or Cowboys. In the Expansion box, you find Weather, Nightfall, and Epic that each in their way adds exiting mechanisms or extra adventuring quests to the mix.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map.

As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Name: The Fully Automated Board Game
Description:
The Fully Automated Board Game is a fast party game based on robots, unionism, and achieving full automation. The game is for 2 to 10 players and features elements of diplomacy, bluffing, and a pinch of Luddism.

In The Fully Automated Board Game you will be able to play the role of a proud worker or a corrupt boss. The goal of the workers, who play semi-cooperatively, is to expropriate as many robots as possible. The objective of the two bosses, competing both with the workers and with each other, is to accumulate lots of money!

Each turn of the game is developed in seven phases and represents one month of work. During the month, bosses can hire workers or build obedient robots. On the other hand, workers are not obliged to accept jobs and can even go on strike, bearing in mind that at the end of the month they may no longer have the money to pay the rent.

—description from the designer
Families: Theme: Labour movement / Workers rights / Unionising

Name: 51st State: Ultimate Edition (Gamefound Edition)
Description:
51st State: Ultimate Edition is the all-in-one package for 51st State, including the base game as well as six expansions: New Era, Winter, Scavengers, Allies, Moloch, and No Man's Land.

In 51st State, the world you know no longer exists. There is no government. No army. No civilization. The United States has collapsed — and now, thirty years after the war started, new powers finally try to take control of the ruined country, try to establish a new order, try to control others and create a new country, a new state: the 51st state.

In this card game, players control one of the four powers — Mutants, Traders, New Yorkers and Appalachians — and try to build their own new country. Players put new locations into the game, hire leaders, and send people to work in buildings to gain resources and new skills.

Every card in 51st State can be put into play three ways: you can invade a location to gain many resources once, or you can sign a contract with this location to gain one resource every turn, or you can attach the location to your State so you can use its skill. One card, three possibilities. Lots of decisions and choices that matter.

The Gamefound edition also comes with all of the mini-expansions and promos released prior to 2022, component upgrades, and a fictional story set in the Neuroshima world. In more detail, with this edition, you have eight factions available for play instead of four, a dedicated neoprene playmat for the No Man's Land expansion, engraved wooden markers, and many promos that expand the game even more.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Co na to Češi?
Description: Board game for two teams of players, where they compete and try to guess and answer to question. Answers were submitted by Czech people and players try to guess, what the people answered the most.

Name: Twinkle: Kickstarter exclusives
Description:
A pack of 24 extra cards given to backers of the Twinkle Kickstarter campaign.

The pack includes 14 new event cards and 10 new mission cards.

Name: Shaar: Motley Lands Massacre
Description:
Shaar: Motley Lands Massacre board game is a progressive, interactive game, of which the game plot is determined according to the main scenario. Players will take on the role of legendary heroes with their own special set of animals, holy trees and they will choose their own path for traveling through the magical universe of Shaar.

At the start of the game, each player chooses a character, tree, and animal card. The player then chooses a path to take. They select a card (event, item, or road card) based on their current location and tour. Players roll dice to accomplish certain goals and events, as well as to determine who wins battles and duels, during gameplay. Finally, the game progresses along the road with the player's character growth, finishing in victory by fighting the endgame bosses.

The ultimate achievement in the game is to first destroy the enemy elements by reaching the campsites located at the end of the city routes to be determined and then to gain a victory by destroying endgame bosses. Besides the main mission, there are many sub-duties within the game. The sub-duties, which are shaped through the edicts and road cards individuated according to cities, directly affect the development of the player’s character and animal; also, it enables the player to reach a lot of opportunities.

Name: Race to Stupid
Description:
"The party trivia game where you can outsmart the smartie pants with the stupidest answers and win the game."

The judge reads a question from a card, and all other players write down two answers - their best guess at the "real answer" and then their funniest "stupid answer".

A correct real answer gets 1 point, but the funniest "stupid answer" (as decided by the judge) gets 2 points.

Play in rounds, so everyone has the same number of turns to be the judge. Tally up points at the end of the game.

Name: Six Greetings Card Games
Description:
Six games entirely contained within greetings cards.

The game board is the front of the card, with the rules on the reverse. On the back, cut off the component section and flip out the player aid and you're ready to play! When you're finished, use the envelope as a game box.

The games are inspired by classic board games, but re-imagined with a hobby gaming lens. Various mechanics, player counts and complexity...

A closer look at the six games:

     Splinter: A resource management, paper-cutting party game (3-8 players)
     Enemy Lines: A head-to-head strategy game (2 players)
     Guess How: A cooperative legacy game (1-4 players)
     In the Dining Room with the Hatchet: A cut-throat programming game (3-6 players)
     Snakes, Ladders and a Pogo Stick: A worker placement racing game (3-5 players)
     Another Life: An economic action selection game (2-4 players)


These are big games in small formats.
Give a card that's also a game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Bimini
Description:
The players take turns placing a tile on the game board. New tiles must be placed side by side with tiles already placed, thereby only connecting areas of the same shade (light or dark blue).

The players get points awarded for each placed tile. When all tiles are placed or the remaining tiles can't be placed, the player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Rot tabu
Description:
The players place 6 tiles (1-6) white side up on the lower row of their tableau. Then the players take turns rolling the die. After each roll the player may take the white tile with the rolled number from the tableau of his right neighbor and places it red side up on the upper row of his own tableau if he has the complimentary white tile on his lower row. If not he places it white side up on his lower row. If a player already has both tiles, the new tile is placed white side up on his own white tile. Red tiles are safe and may never be taken.

If A player has at least 4 red tiles he may take white tiles from any player. If a player has only one white tile left, and has not the corresponding red tile he may place the tile red side up on his upper row without rolling a die.

The first player with 6 red tiles wins the game.

Rule printed inside box cover.

Name: Game Of Pawns: Iron Cauldron
Description:
Game of Pawns: Iron Cauldron gives you the opportunity to become king Izanoff and save the holy city of Argenost from King Horvat the Horrible. Lead a bunch of misfits from the infamous 2nd Infantry Izanoff Regiment against the powerful and dreaded Horvatian Army in the Battle of the Iron Cauldron.

In this two-player chess-like game, players can switch sides for the Second Battle of the Iron Cauldron for a purely unique battle experience. The invading Horvatian Army units can receive promotions while 2nd Infantry Izanoff Regiment can receive reinforcements from the city of Argenost. In the third and final battle, 2nd Infantry faces off against King Horvat's elite Wolf Guard Regiment in an epic game of pawns.

To win the game, you capture or trap your opponent's king or they are forced to surrender. The game ends with a draw if capturing the king becomes futile for either side.

Each player takes turns moving a unit towards the enemy based on their unit's movement/attack ability, to gain ground, capture enemy pieces, set traps, enforce area denial or perform counteroffensive operations.

Get Ready: War is Coming!
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Monumental Consequence
Description:
In the role-play-based negotiation game Monumental Consequence, players take the roles of townsfolk of La Ville, whose church has been taken over by an invading army. Do you risk your lives to attack the church to save the art — or bomb it?

Similar to social deduction games, each player has a designated role, with victory conditions associated with it. Players negotiate and vote to settle on a decision. If the vote is inconclusive, a dice-rolling mechanism is used to complicate the scenario and start a new round. Play continues until one side has enough votes, then a final die roll determines the winner and the consequences of that choice.

Name: Flip That House The Board Game
Description:
Flip That House The Board Game takes its players through the journey of real estate investing, also known today as "house flipping".  The first "flipper" to acquire one million dollars in cash and property, is declared the Ultimate Flipping Mogul.

Flippers begin with $250,000 in cash and a flip.  The flipper that rolls the highest number on the dice begin play and then clock wise for the next flippers turn.  Flippers roll dice and move the appropriate spaces on the colorful and bright game board, following the action on the spot in which they landed.

This game will provide hours of fun and education for groups of all ages.

Name: Heads Up!: Adult Expansion Pack
Description:
The Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack with 200 all-new cards works with any version of the popular party game, Heads Up!. While Heads Up! is a fun family game, the Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack is something to whip out at your next adult party.

Four racy categories include Adult Supervision (1), Adult Supervision 2: Even Adultier, Adult Supervision 3: Bad Behavior, and Adult Supervision 4: Bachelorette Party. In the Adult Supervision (1 & 2) and Bachelorette Party categories, you guess words based on verbal clues. In the Bad Behavior category, you act out words for your teammate to guess. How would you act out Mud Wrestling, Pole Dance, or Sobriety Test? Those are just a few examples of what we can safely mention here.

Race the timer to guess the adult words you're wearing on your headband, based on your teammate's verbal clues. Or watch them act out the words and guess the answers before time's up!

The Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack is a salacious supplement to the Heads Up! Game (sold separately). With 200 new cards (the same amount as in the original game), it's a whole new game that adults only are invited to play!

--publisher's description

Name: Kooky Cats
Description:
Kooky Cats is a cat collecting card game featuring over 50 quirky and close-knit cats brought to life by Jean Jullien in his second collaboration with us ? It’s a bit like Happy Families meets Go Fish, but where all the fish have been eaten by cats, and instead of being happy, the families are all a bit bonkers.

The game features twelve groups, or Cat-egories as we like to call them, each consisting of four cats with the same distinguishing features. To win, you want to collect the most complete Cat-egories before the game ends. However with Special Cards and Kooky Tokens thrown in the mix, things might not always go to plan.

As well as twelve Cat-egories, the game features seven stupendous Special Cards, twelve Kooky Tokens, and the game changing, face-shifting The Cat That Got The Cream Card. The Special Cards consist of Catnap, Back'cat You!, Cat's Got My Tongue, the Catfish, and of course the Dodgy Dog – each with the ability to turn the game upside down!

Name: Think: Logo Cards
Description:
70 cards with puzzles in three difficulty stages that are to be solved using logic, fantasy and an eye for details. Points can be scored upon solving the puzzle depending on difficulty, and some extra points when answering a surprise extra question regarding details in the picture. Solution and explanation are provided on the back of the picture cards. Every card is a single puzzle only.

Description from the publisher:
"Lösen Sie knifflige Bilderrätsel. Allein mit Logik und Fantasie." ("Solve challenging picture puzzles with logic and fantasy alone.")

Name: Wheatford Court Castle
Description: A myriorama storytelling game based in a mysterious castle. There are three variations on the rules: In the Explore the castle variation, players take turns contributing to the story using the cards in hand; In the discover the secrets variation, players aren't offered the choice; in the Investigate the mystery variation, one player is the perpetrator of the crime, and the story is structured around that.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Dominion
Description:
A Warhammer Age of Sigmar boxed set with two sizable armies – including all-new units and even a never-before-seen subfaction of the Orruk Warclans – a copy of the updated Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Book with exclusive full-art cover, and more.

Dominion includes a mighty Lord-Imperatant with accompanying Gryph-hound, a spell-casting Knight-Arcanum, a Knight-Vexillor with Banner of Apotheosis, three each of the elite Praetors and Annihilators, and 10 Vindictors. Not only that, but it includes the huntress supreme, Yndrasta, the Celestial Spear – a legendary hero of the Stormcast Eternals whose knowledge of Ghur, the Realm of Beasts, is second to none.

Meanwhile, the Kruleboyz of the Thondian swamplands are a malicious, spiteful breed of orruks whose presence has, until recently, been shrouded by the cloying mists of their home. Despite being new to the setting, the Kruleboyz can fight alone as an army in their own right or alongside any of the other forces from the Orruk Warclans. Dominion includes a pair of hulking Killabosses – one riding a Great Gnashtoof, and the other accompanied by a Stab-grot – a Swampcalla Shaman and Pot-grot minion, a Murknob with Belcha-banna, three Man-skewer Boltboyz, 10 murderous Gutrippaz and 20 sneaky Hobgrot Slittaz.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vier Königreiche
Description:
For many centuries there was peace in the four great kingdoms and life in the lands was simple and carefree. One day, however, unfriendly and warlike tribes appeared from the lands beyond the horizon and brought danger to the four kingdoms. The four rulers decided together to protect the people from the evil invaders and bring them into the cities. However, because the cities were too small and unsafe, they were first to be enlarged and expanded. Defensive towers, churches and a city wall were to be built around the stately palace, which was also to be newly erected. And so the great builders of the world were commissioned to plan and implement the buildings for the kingdom of the mountain lands in the north, the kingdom of the sun in the east, the desert kingdom in the south and the kingdom of the forest peoples in the west. In order to get all this done in time before a possible attack by the enemy tribes, the builders gather people from all walks of life - from peasants to princes - to help and cooperate from the lands. Each person is given his or her task, which must be completed exactly according to plan and order.

You and your fellow players slip into the role of these master builders. Everyone tries to place all their cards with the helping citizens on the building sites before all the other players. Act wisely and strategically as a master builder and you may become the greatest master builder of the four kingdoms...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Das große Allgemeinwissen-Quiz
Description:
If anyone knows about general knowledge, it's him: The TV-famous "know-it-all" Sebastian Klussmann presents 300 entertaining questions, divided into the ten official knowledge categories of the German Quiz Championships.
After participating in this quiz, you are guaranteed to be smarter!

Name: Das große Deutsch-Quiz
Description: Everything that makes the German language appealing is celebrated in this high-quality equipped quiz box! Lovers of language and literature can look forward to a variety of exciting questions and equally instructive and enlightening answers.

Name: Write on Track
Description:
In Write on Track, a new Train game, players will be connecting Cities, gaining influence, and increasing population all in a push to import and export goods. Each turn 2 six-sided dice are rolled and 1-100 players simultaneously complete actions using each of the dice. The player can mark Influence in an area of the map, which can gain them bonus abilities. The player can use the die value to fill in Population rings of a City to show its demand for Imported goods. The player can also use the value to connect two Cities in a matching region or to connect a City from that region to an adjacent City in another region.

Players will find plenty of ways to earn Stars in this Sandbox style game! Stars are used to trigger game end. Further, the game includes a 9 card expansion deck that allows for Campaign play as players open up new ways of earning Stars and the player who won a previous game starts with a bonus at the beginning of the next game, the losing players also receive a bonus to start the next game. Play a Campaign of 10 games and see who had the greatest total of Stars across the entire Campaign! The Campaign can also be played solo, can you get to 300 Stars?

—description from the designer

Name: Måsen, Draken och Kastellet
Description:
The knights do their best to climb to the top of the castle, while taking care of flying seagulls, dragons and the daring knights of their opponents. Everyone wants to escape from the castle's scary dungeon! Which strategy do you choose - to focus on fast climbing to the top of the castle, or do you have time to stop to stop the competing knights with sweeping tricks? The player with the first knight who reaches the top of the castle wins the game.

Players take turns playing cards to get their knights to the top.

Name: Deeldo
Description:
When you play Deeldo, you have one and only mission: to create majestic, flamboyand Deeldoes.

Of course, there are some rules to follow. First things first, it's not about real toys. You have a card deck, where the three parts of which a Deeldo is made - a head, a body and a base - are depicted. You draw your initial hand, compose Deeldoes on the desk, and then wait for your friends while they do the same. Each turn, you draw two cards - and history repeats.

Deeldoes must start with a base, end with a head, and have at least a body part in it. There is no limit to the Deeldo composition - more the colors, more the fun, after all - but remember that there are combos that can bring you more points. Vibrating and studded Deeldoes give you more points, just like color-matching toys.

When a player has completed their 3rd Deeldo, or when cards are finished, the game is over. The player with the highest score wins, and gets the chance to start the following match. The one with the lower score, instead, wears the Crown of the Loser. It's the rules, baby.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pocket Quiz: Stadt, Land, Quiz
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 surprising and curious questions about cities, countries, rivers, beaches, buildings, sights, national parks and other geographical facts. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "city, country, quiz".

Name: All About Animals
Description:
Does the Alpine marmot weigh more than 20 kilos? And does the pink flamingo live in Africa? This quiz game is all about 200 large and small animals from all over the world. The players' knowledge is put to the test in 12 categories. The players can also reach the goal with good estimation skills and courageous steps.
Lots of fun is guaranteed here!

Name: Black Stories: Leichen, Pech & Pannen Edition
Description:
Deadly football goals, human stew in the Jacuzzi, exotic delicacies that bite back without further ado: incomprehensible accidents, catastrophic coincidences and dramatic passing ...
The Grim Reaper is never at a loss for ideas when it comes to decimating his flock. And reality still invents the darkest stories!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

Name: Black Stories: Carefull Conspiracy
Description:
In the bizarre world of conspiracy myths, nothing is too far-fetched not to be claimed.
For conspiracy theorists, everything is connected to everything else and nothing happens without a reason. But be careful: For those who believe such things will be in for a huge blow in these brand-new black stories!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

Name: Fingerlings: Treetop Fall Game
Description:
You're good at keeping your Fingerlings on your finger, but can you keep them from falling out of the tree in the new Fingerlings Treetop Fall Game?

This is a classic skill-and-action game where players take turns pulling branches out of the tree without letting any of the monkey pieces inside the tree fall out. You've got to spin the spinner to find out what color branch you should remove, or maybe you'll get lucky and spin the skip space so you don't have to remove any branch that turn. If any monkeys fall to the bottom of the tree on your turn, you keep them. Once all the monkeys have fallen out of the tree, the game ends and the player with the fewest monkeys wins.

Name: AuZtralia: Promo Packet 1
Description:
AuZtralia Promo Pack 1 released for the Kickstarter campaign for the AuZtralia expansions: TaZmania and Revenge of the Old Ones.

Includes new Mythos cards and Helper cards to be used with the base game:

3 new Mythos cards: Cthulhu, Bokrug, Nightgaunt
3 new Solo Mythos cards: Cthulhu, Bokrug, Nightgaunt
10 Helper cards: "Buddy" Budowski, Florence Poison, Elsa Ware, Lord Switchener, Iron Horse Bob, Charles Grey, Captain Rex Porter, Doctor Anton Phibes, Doctor Herbert Combs, and Emily Earhart

The new Mythos cards share the same character names but have slightly different abilities depending on if it's a solo or a regular game: 

     different points (solo: next to card name, regular: upper left corner),
     different backs, and
     different rules or text (Nightgaunt is about stealing from another player for 5 turns in the regular game, and in the solo game it's about losing a personality card for 5 turn; and Bokrug and Cthulhu have similar rules between the regular and solo games).

Name: Hoffer
Description:
Hoffer is a precision bidding card game for 2 - 4 players.  In this game, players will secretly bid on how many tricks they will try to capture.  Accuracy is key as players who hit their bid will earn the most points.

Players wrestle with changing hand sizes, Jacks that move up in rank, and Jokers that automatically win or lose the trick.  With the use of a tight 34 card deck, the Bower system borrowed from Euchre, and jokers that replicate the wizard and jester from Wizard, players will scramble for points as they travel up the river.

Whoever has the most points at the end of the final round wins the game.

Name: Elerion: het bordspel
Description: In this narrative adventure game, players must work together as they slog through cities, wilderness, dungeons and caves. However, watch out for the hidden agendas of fellow players. The characters that survive the game can come back in the next adventure and you can even string together a whole series of scenarios. There is even the option to write new screenplays yourself. The future is uncertain!

Name: Alieninjas
Description:
Some creatures have escaped from the S.O.L.A.R. Laboratory. They had been captured in space and were dubbed Alieninjas due to their capacity to camouflage, turning into other creatures.
However, these little monsters cannot camouflage completely, and they end up leaving important parts of their anatomy exposed, making their identification and capture easier.
You are agents of S.B.F. - Special Biosecurity Force - assigned to retrieve all those creatures while keeping a low profile.
Alieninjas are 5 unique mission-based games, which will put your agility, memory, and reasoning to the test, promoting the winner to the rank of institution commander.

Name: Absolutely Stonkers!
Description:
Absolutely Stonkers! is an easy to learn strategic card game that was born out of the 2021 meme stock mania which took the world by storm. The game is fast-paced, funny, and has two ways to win.

Players draw and discard cards to collect stocks and stopother players from colleecting them. Be the first to collect a Stonk (stock) card from each of the seven industries or the last one standing after all the other players have been indicted by the SEC to win. There are plenty of ways to sabotage other players and evade the SEC while on the way to become a Stonk Titan.

Name: Happy Little Dinosaurs: Dating Disasters Expansion Pack
Description:
The only thing worse than a falling meteor? A first date.

In this 54-card expansion pack, you might dodge the dreaded friendzone, encounter a giant catfish, or go out with a dino who says “I love you” way too early. Awkward...

Name: Les 4 Pandastiques
Description:
A long time ago, 4 extraordinary creatures lived among us: the pandastics 4!
But one day, to protect the 3 others, the 4th creature disappeared... Many adventurers went in search of it and it is said that to make it reappear, you must accomplish quests engraved in the ruins of an ancient temple...
During your adventure, it is up to you to be the most observant, attentive and clever to succeed in these legendary quests!
At the end of the road, you may discover this mythical creature that is just waiting to reappear: the Pand4stic!

Complete quests to solve the mystery of the Pandastic 4:
Turn your cards over wisely, using your memory to combine the characteristics of your cards!
But stop in time so you don't lose everything and score more points than your opponents!

Memory, risk-taking and daring will be essential for you to become the best adventurer and discover the Pand4stic!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lustige Reise
Description:
The players take turns rolling a die and start their meeples at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Published in the hardcover annual "Das Kränzchen" No. 26

Name: Betwixt and Between: Forces of Nature
Description:
So, you’ve decided to return… and this time you come.. somewhat prepared. With artifacts lending you powers... But there’s also new challenges ahead. Traces of faery dust around the land, and new places rearranging the world… Whirlwinds, sacred trees, moon paths... and not to forget, new powerful master spells to learn.... Are you sure you’re ready?

The Forces of Nature expansion for Betwixt and Between includes new powerful artifacts giving each Mystic a magic boost at the start of the game and a special ability to use throughout the game.

The expansion also includes more Exploration Cards with new adventurous places to visit with new actions for your Mystic to put to use to create epic turns!

There are also new challenging master spells to learn for big amount of points, rewarding being smart and creative when building your Magic Weave. 

Our Mystics will also find magical Faery Dust sprinkled around the game board, presenting a brand new resource to collect and score points from in different ways! 

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Stories Junior: Pferde Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: horse stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

In these horse-powered riddles about fake coat colours, spooky ghost horses, exploding dung heaps, botched riding holidays or ponies in mortal danger, you have to combine things smartly and think cleverly around corners to uncover their secrets.

Name: Black Stories Junior: Unbelievable Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: unbelievable stories are tricky riddles for animal lovers. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

In these incredible strategy stories about life-saving monster waves, dried-up waterfalls, flying children, monkeys with foreign language skills and budgies with their own phone number things are always a little strange. Only those who ask, puzzle and guess, to uncover these really true secrets.

Black Stories Junior: unbelievable stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

Name: Fischers Fritz
Description:
Tongue twisters are a real challenge - and quite funny for the listeners. The faster you speak these sentences, the greater the possibility of slurring your words.

How to play:

     You pick a card and repeat the tongue twister three times.
     Does it work without mistakes? You get to keep the card.
     Does it not work? The next person tries to repeat the tongue twister three times.
     The person who has collected the most cards wins.

Name: IT Startup: Office Lockdown
Description: IT Startup - Office Lockdown is a stand-alone expansion to "IT Startup - The Card Game". It contains 50% more components than the older "IT Startup - The Card Game" base game from 2020. It is playable for 1-6 players (standard game mode with a shared deck), with additional 2 vs 2, custom deck, solo and tournament modes. Aside from being a stand-alone game it can also be combined with previous game editions.

Name: Nak Makan Apa
Description:
What’s the hardest question for a group to answer when they’re out? Nak makan apa? - “What do you want to eat?”

Nak Makan Apa is a bilingual (Bahasa Melayu and English) card game, where you take it in turns to play flavours you want to eat, with the aim of finding a meal that matches the collective taste.

There’s also a bit of take that as you can play ‘songeh’ cards to frustrate the other players and cancel some of their meals.

First to make four meals wins.

Name: Catch the Wave
Description:
It had to end eventually! Humanity has finally become extinct. Just the Tanuki survived.

These legendary Japanese creates have all the random leftover stuff from people in the bin and have only picked up a few memorabilia. The hottest boards in the world! They surf as much as possible. Infinite space, free beaches and the big surf battle every weekend, when the waves hit first and then glow. Everyone catches a huge wave here. Which brings us to the topic. This game is like life. In the end, the one who gets their shit together wins. Get as many cards as possible in the correct sequence resulting in the longest wave — and on it the winner surfs away.

—description from the rulebook

Each turn, players draw a card with a value from one to twenty from the central pile of cards. Then, they add it their own row of cards. The goal is to arrange your cards in ascending order, but after you've placed a card in your row, it is turned face-down, and you'll need to remember where you put each card.

The game ends when the pile of cards runs out. The player that has created the longest sequence of ascending cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Honey
Description:
Honey is a game of bag building we hope will get you buzzing! Players work simultaneously on their own player sheets using roles dice results to fill in abilities as well as gain knowledge about flowers.

Beekeepers set up gardens to produce certain blends of Honey and now you will too! Knowing your flowers, then getting the bees to produce the most expensive jars will be among your tasks. Additionally, every five rounds players will choose a scoring option from a bonus card! Maximize your resources, rolls, and get ready for bag building with dice!

Players complete 25 total rounds and at game end will score points for completed flowers in rows and columns as well as scoring bonuses for Honey and bonus abilities. The winner will have earned the most points from their in-game and final scoring!

Honey plays 1-100 players. Roll and write your way through the tulips as you gain knowledge of blooms to grow your apiary and bee the best you can bee!

Name: Blood Coven
Description:
Blood Coven is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are vampires competing to create a coven of vampies and a herd of victims to feed on. Blood coven features mechanics from the vampire game from Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes. Coins in supply and city(play area) are "villagers". Coins in a players hand or fatigue area are "victims" and coins on turn order slots on the player card are "vampires'.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (feed, action, refresh). Players use pieces from their hands (victims) to feed any hungry vampires on their player cards and take actions. If any hungry vampires are not fed, they die. The game ends when there are no villagers left in the village or supply area.

The player with the most victory points wins. Players receive 1vp per victim in their possession. Vampires are worth 3vp for penny vampires, 4vp for nickel vampires, 5vp for dime vampires.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat or even cat and vampire against a god from Eldritch Cults.

Name: WereKittens
Description:
WereKittens is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are wereKittens competing to eat villagers and convert villagers into a powerful team of wereKittens. WereKittens features mechanics from the werecat game from Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (place victims, action, refresh)

phase 1 place victims: players place victims from their hand into their feed and/or scare areas if they want to feed them to cats this turn.

phase 2 Action: During this phase, each werecat takes its action in order.(each werecat has its own turn order/initiative number). players each begin with 1 werecat and create more as the game progresses. On its turn, a werecat may either, take a villager from the village as a victim or turn one of the villagers in the village into a werecat.

In this game, penny werecats have the most strength but are expensive to make and are not worth many points. dime werecats are weak, but are cheap to make and worth a lot of points. nickels are in the middle.

The game ends when there are no villagers left in the village or supply area.

The player with the most victory points wins.  werecats are worth 2vp for penny werecats, 3vp for nickel werecats, 4vp for dime werecats.
victims are worth 2 vp for the victim type you have the most of, 1vp for the type you have second most of, and 0 for the type you have least of.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat, or even cat and vampire against a god from Eldritch Cults. 
 Components: (12 cards, 1 rulesheet)

The player with the most victory points wins. .

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat or 2 vampires against a god from Eldritch Cults.

Name: Eldritch Cults
Description:
Eldritch Cults is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are weird and Lovecraftian gods who are competing to lure villagers into their cults. this game features mechanics from the cult game Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes. Coins in supply and the city (play area) are "villagers". Coins that are tails up or in the fatigue area are cultists, heads-up coins are priests.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (place cultists, action, fatigue). 
In phase 1, players place cultists on temples to enable actions.

in phase 2, temples can take actions. Temples, on their turn can either turn a villager into a cultist or a priest.

in phase 3, players take back any cultists that were fatigued on the previous turn, then move any cultists they used this turn into the fatigue area.

Game ends when there are no coins left in the supply area or village.

The player with the most victory points wins. Players receive 1vp per cultist in their possession. Priests are worth 4vp for penny priests, 5vp for nickel priests, 6vp for dime priests.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat, or 2 vampires, or 2 cats, or a mix of vampires and cats against a god from Eldritch Cults.

Name: Die rasante Dino-Rallye
Description:
Oh no, the Spinosaurus attacks! It's your mission to help the Colby brothers, who want to safe the other, peace-loving dinosaurs and bring them to their shelter. And don't forget to rescue the Colby brothers, too. The final task to win, is to put the safety fence into action. Players act in a cooperative way to achieve this, all together win or lose.

The game is driven by dice rolling mechanics. Depending on the dice roll, you have to move either the Spinosaurus or one of the Colby brothers. Each of the brothers has to move once, before they may move again. On their way back and forth they collect Dinosaurs and put them into their trailer, bringing them to the shelter. The Spinosaurus always moves towards the shelter. If the Spinosaurus reaches the shelter before this, you fail.

Name: Crystal Taking
Description:
Crystal Taking is a trick-taking game. Players take turns playing cards to tricks in hopes of winning or losing tricks.

The game uses 56 minor arcana card, and 22 major. Minor arcana cards can be played right-side up to predict a victory or upside-down to predict defeat. The major arcana cards determine the rules for the round. There are typically three rule cards in play. You can pay VPs to put a new one from your hand into play (they each have 2 orientations also); the rules work as a conveyor, so when you add a new one, the oldest is removed.

After a certain number of rounds the game ends, leaving the player with the most points as the winner.

Name: Spiralchain: Foreverot
Description:
SpiralChain: Foreverot is a fully cooperative board game based on the SpiralChain novels by Jeremiah L. Schwennen. Between one and eight players work together to defeat the Foreverot before it can unleash untold suffering upon the Spiral of Worlds. The players win or lose as one--there are no victory points to tally or secret agendas to work towards.

Each player will have a Role Card that gives them special abilities to aid in their efforts, and each world has a limited number of enigmatic guardian dragons that might be employed to help fend off Warlords and Obliviates.

Players will travel from world to world gathering resources and making occasional forays into Nur to discard Rot Tokens until all eight of those tokens have been discarded and the heroes emerge victorious. But things are never quite that easy, are they? Gathering resources is made more difficult by the presence of maniacal Warlords that seek to destroy key locations on each world and malevolent Obliviates--scouts for the Foreverot--that block the heroes' efforts wherever they can. The same resources that are used to stop the Rot must also be used to vanquish Warlords and Obliviates, making for tough choices in each and every round of play. And the clock is always against you.

At the end of each round of play, the current First Player will roll a die in a grim responsibility we call the Foreverot Roll. This die will determine whether or not the Rot advances in its own schemes, wreaking havoc across the game. If those schemes advance too far--if all of the Foreverot Cards on Nur are played--the Rot will win. But even if the die roll is kind and a new Foreverot Card is not played, damage will be visited upon worlds and Warlords will continue in their inexorable march, bringing ruin to whatever lies in their path.

In about an hour, the fate of the 8 worlds can be decided... but in the quest to forge the Spiralchain, almost anything can happen!

Name: Gif It To Me
Description:
Gif It To Me is a comedic adult party game where 3-10 players use caption cards to react to popular GIFs displayed on a smartphone using a free app.

One player is the judge and picks a GIF from the app. Everyone else picks the funniest caption card from their hand to pair with the GIF and passes it face down to the judge. The judge reads the caption cards aloud and selects their favorite. Whoever’s caption card is selected by the judge wins the round and scores one point.

The game ends when the bossiest person in the room says it ends. It's recommended to assert dominance early on so you can end the game once you are winning.

Advanced play options include keeping your hand fresh by using action cards to add a twist to basic gameplay or mixing in mature cards for extra spicy humor.

Name: Mettle to the Petal
Description:
The root idea is simple: you’ve been dealt quite a handful, and your task is to empty your hand before your opponents do, matching the card atop the discard pile in face value or color. (Play one card per turn, and do what it says!)

Will you be the first person to play your last card? Be alert, because every card has stipulations, and the strategy increases with each expansion set of the game.

You’ll need your wits sharp and your attention undistracted, if you are to win. Good luck.

Name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Allies Pack
Description:
The allies pack includes 6 jumbo size ally cards and 7 new fuzzy mages. An ally is chosen by each mage at the beginning of the game to aid them in their quest. Allies have special abilities such as adding more attack power, slowing down opponents mineons, and forcing opponents to discard cards. Beware, however, as some of them require payment for their friendship.

Allies: Four-winged owl, Raccoon Mafia, Hired Muscle, Skunk Squad, Possum Posse, Jerry

Mages: Tag mage, Yesh mage, Rugged mage, Drabhu mage, Falala mage, Septimus mage, Niú Gá Táng mage

Name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Silver Fox Pack
Description: Silver is based on the artist of fuzzy mage fight. Like the mage hunters, Silver has his own item cards and even a personal mineon that aid him in his quest.

Name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Mage Hunter Pack
Description:
The mage hunters are fuzzy animals that have no magical powers but wield unique weapons that aid them in their desire to be the most "magical" fuzzy mage in the land!

Each mage hunter has 3 item cards that are played in the battlefield that offer epic abilities for fighting against the fuzzy mages.

Mage Hunters: Kiki Hunter, Wraggles Hunter

Name: Julii
Description:
Julii is a game where you navigate the political intrigues of republican Rome as the head of one of four prominent families, the Julii, the Cornelii, the Sempronii and the Claudii.

These families are made up of senators, statesmen, and other members of Rome’s elite governing class who share the same gentes, that is claim descent from a common ancestor, and the same ambition: to rule the Roman Republic.

The objective of the game is to gain political supremacy over rival families. Ultimately, the family with the most social status, wealth, popularity, and provincial control is declared the winner. To gain supremacy you must ensure that statesmen affiliated with your family wage successful military campaigns, govern prosperous provinces, control key industries, and implement effective political reforms.

Julii is a 2-4 player game that starts in 264 BC at the outbreak of the 1st Punic War and ends with the turmoil and civil wars of the late 1st Century BC. A full game is played over 10 turns, with each turn representing approximately 20-25 years. Several scenarios are included introducing shorter game duration and modified winning conditions.

Name: Was ist Was: Junior – Ritter
Description: In the children's game for ages 4 and up, the players choose their medieval knight figure, each from a different era. The cards with the images of heads, bodies, legs, and arms lie face down in the center. Now the fun begins! What number does the die show? Is there a matching part for your own knight? If not, just give it to another player. The first player to finish the puzzle has won. But be careful! A robber baron has mingled with the knights in this exciting educational game. If the knight is completed first, everyone has lost together in this children's game.

Name: Voyagers
Description:
Voyagers is a pre-progammable race game where you step in the footsteps of famous voyagers. It is your goal to (re-) discover the marvels of the world, while being sabotaged by your competitors.

Initially 3 locations to be discovered are set out and every player needs to try to become the first voyager discovering these sights. Every turn 5 navigation cards are chosen and put in a 5 step program, which needs to be programmed upfront. Once the program is executed step by step, you need to set out course to these discoveries and avoid being sabotaged.

After the fourth discovery is done, every player gets its own secret discovery card and once the first player has discovered this last secret discovery the game ends. The player with most discovery points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Akademia Superbohaterów
Description:
This game (which could be translated to "Superhero Academy") is about Polish scientist that made a great impact in the history of science.

The game consist of 30 cards with a different scientist on each card. On a player's turn they draw a card from the pile and ask other players questions (which are actually clues) about the scientist (the questions are presented on the cards). The first player to guess which scientist the question(s) refer(s) to score 1-3 points depending on how many clue-questions they needed (more clues - less points).

The game ends when there are no cards in the pile and the player who scored the most points is the winner.

—user summary

Akademia Superbohaterów to fascynujÄ…ca rozgyrwka, która pozwala odkryÄ‡ znanych i nieznanych polskich bohaterów.

Gra karciana w formie quizu. Przeznaczona jest dla minimum dwóch graczy w wieku od 7 lat (gracze muszÄ… umieÄ‡ czytaÄ‡). Jej celem jest zgromadzenie jak najwiÄ™kszej liczby punktów.

Punkty sÄ… przyznawane za wiedzÄ™ o najwiÄ™kszych polskich naukowacach, a takÅ¼e za refleks.

—description from the back of the box

Name: The Longest Trench: Expansion
Description:
This is an Expansion to The Longets Trench funded by a Kickstarter Campaign. It consists of a Battleboard and 10 Minicards delivered in a Ziplockbag.

The Battleboard facilitate the battles due to a better overview for the players. The Minicards add some variations to the existing battles.

Name: Yortuk
Description:
Based on the second Jabari book, it is a card game where you must capture monsters by making pairs.

Each turn the active player must draw a card from another player, in case of making a pair, he must play it, each monster has a power and a value. Resolves the power and passes the turn.

The game ends when a player begins their turn with no cards in hand, and each player will score the value of each monster in their play area minus the points of the pairs they have in hand.
whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Brako
Description:
Based on the novel "Dog Mystery", a group of puppies have to stop BRAKO, an android dog who wants to usurp the role of animal death.

A board is built with tiles (5x5 for 2-3 players, or 6x6 for 4-5 players) where the skeletons of animals killed by BRAKO will be hidden.

The pups have 2 actions to perform each turn, they must choose between moving by rolling 1d6, removing a stone from the terrain, digging in a clear terrain. Resolve an event card and end turn.

BRAKO moves when events dictate, if he manages to completely damage a pup and they don't have a bone to heal it, the cubs loses.

If the pups manage to unearth the animal skeletons (4 in a 2-3 player game and 8 in a 4-5 player game) they will stop BRAKO and win the game.

Name: La Rata Ricarda
Description:
Based on the novel of the same name.
The Mice are trapped in the sewers under the serpentarium, and must escape by rescuing as many mice as possible, but among them there is a traitor, if the traitor leaves the first, he will close the exit trapping them.

Each turn the active player take a tile and place it as part of the sewer, can move up to 2 spaces and resolve an event card.

The tiles allow you to draw item cards or rescue mice.
the events will indicate when to remove the sewer covers, when the 4th is removing, the mice will be able to get out.

If the traitor mouse comes out first, he wins.
If at least 1 brave mouse manages to leave before, when the traitor mouse leaves, the rescued mice will be counted on each side and the one with the most will win.

Name: Solitaire Legends: Guinevere
Description: Morgan le fay hast placed a curse over Camelot! There art four Arthurs seated at the round table. Three art changelings who've stolen the king's true form. Guinevere must find Merlin's crystals and send the imposters back to the faerie realm. But maketh haste, for the fabled knights art under the witch's spell and seek to destroyeth thee!
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: Flippity Frog
Description:
First player to return 4 Froglets safely home wins!

Mummy frog must successfully carry her Froglets on her back across the pond, leaping from lilypad to lilypad. Each lilypad is turned over to reveal the next step mummy frog can take.

If you come across Big Bad Fish it’s the end of your go! Or, take a Super Jump home!

Mummy frog must flip over four lilypads to safely cross the pond!

—description from the publisher

Name: Whose Nest?
Description:
Crafty Croc has stolen all the eggs! Luckily, we have his swag bag. Can you return all the eggs to their correct nests?

Roll the dice! If you roll an egg, take the egg and place it in a nest. Will it hatch as a Chick or a Croc? If a chick, take a token...if a Croc, oh no! put the egg back in the bag.

Each player after their go, spins the nest! Can you remember where the croc hatched?

The first player to return all 3 baby chicks to the nest wins!

—description from the publisher
